definition: dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: After breakfast, i went to the vegetable field with grandmother.
sentences.chinese: 早飯後，我和奶奶一起去了菜地裏。

sentences.english: I wannna share with my new Chinese neighbor at garden.
sentences.chinese: 我打算和我菜地裏新的中國鄰居分享菜苗。

sentences.english: As result, we have to water the vegetable garden.
sentences.chinese: 殷此我們郴得不給菜地澆水。

sentences.english: All around the village are vegetable fields.
In the second year, vegetable has become a vegetable.
sentences.chinese: 到了第二年，菜地已經成了熟菜地。

sentences.english: The Abbot sent him to plant vegetable fields as a start of kungfu skill practice.
sentences.chinese: 方丈把他送到工廠菜地作爲功夫技能實踐的開始。

sentences.english: Kaz's father had been out back weeding the vegetables in his underclothes .
sentences.chinese: 和子的父親穿着內衣褲在屋外後院的菜地裏除草。

sentences.english: Almost every day I can see mothers making children water the crops.
sentences.chinese: 三天兩頭的，就能看到媽媽領着孩子忙着給菜地澆水。

definition: embankment or foothpath between paddy fields
to look after/to tend (one's crops, garden, livestock, pets etc)/to repair
